alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 06 at 10:27PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING ALONG THE YUKON RIVER AT EAGLE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...Yukon River at Eagle. * WHEN...Through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...The Yukon River may rise above the natural riverbank. Ice jam flooding has high uncertainty. Impacts could range between localized high water and severe flooding. Now is the the time to take precautions. Where possible, move items to higher ground and prepare your community for possible flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ice is beginning to shift in the vicinity of Eagle. The river has risen approximately seven feet over the last seven days and continues to rise approximately 1 foot every 12 hours. Tributaries including the Fortymile River and Mission Creek are running high. The Yukon River at Eagle is likely to breakup sometime this weekend or early next week and there is intact ice downstream that could cause ice jams to form. Breakup on upriver tributaries has been dynamic with ice jams forming and releasing. Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
